I ran the experiment under valgrind for 3 generations with a populatio=
n size of 5. Valgrind reported some errors. That's the output: http://db.tt=
/HtP0SNGA
 
If i remove the population dump in HCUBE_ExperimentRun.cpp, the=
 initialisation of Go/Checkers in main.cpp and change nodesNeeded.erase(tar=
get) to nodesNeeded.erase(remove(nodesNeeded.begin(), nodesNeeded.end(), pa=
rentNodeID),nodesNeeded.end()) in line 425 and 442 of NEAT_GeneticIndividua=
l.cpp, valgrind reports no errors, but the exception is still thrown in a f=
ull run. 

I have absolutely no clue what I am doing wrong. Also, I wonder =
if it is normal that the longer the experiments runs, the slower it becomes=
?
populateSubstrate() takes longer and longer after each generation.


To s=
uccessfully compile Hyperneat, I only changed the following things in fuego=
:
- mutable deleted in smartgame/SgPointSetUtil.h:68
- additional flag -DBO=
OST_FILESYSTEM_VERSION=3D2

Hyperneat then successfully builds HypercubeNEA=
T, but fails at GoPlayer.

Some details about my system:
gcc-4.6.2
cmake-2.=
8.6
make-3.82
boost-1.47 (also tried 1.45)
kernel-3.1.0-4-ARCH (archlinux)
=

your code ran fine for me.  Can you try running it under valgrind and

 if there are any memory issues?
